name: Shangri-La Hotel Sydney

reviews.text: Having just come from the Shangri La in Hong Kong we were a bit disappointed by this Shangri La. We went from 2 complimentary bottles of water a day to a big sign on the water telling us what it cost to drink it. Also the staff weren't nearly as eager to please as they were in HongKong. It felt very much a business hotel perhaps reflected in the restaurant prices.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: However in saying that it was a good place to stay if you are in Sydney. We had a good room with a view. Our children were in a room next door (however it was not adjoining as we had booked) Bathroom standard good and room servicing good. Lovely little swimming pool which wasn't heavily used. Only minutes down to the harbour but quite steep if you are old.

reviews.title: Great views, shame about the hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for five nights in July of 2006 as part of a round the world trip, and found the Shangri-La to be excellent.

On arrival we were given the opportunity to inspect the Opera House View room we had chosen, and were then shown a Full Harbour View room which was available at only an additional AUD$40 per night. We immediately took this as the new room we were shown on the 29th floor had without doubt one of the best views in the world – the photo doesn’t do it any justice. We both said that the view would be one of those that would last forever and would be worth nearly any money. The only time we had a view of a similar standard was over looking the city of Cape Town and Table Mountain.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights in early February 2011 and had the unfortunate timing to arrive when a heatwave struck. You expect a five star hotel to have decent air conditioning in a first world city known for hot weather, but the system is archaic and has little control over the temperature (either cool or warm and low, medium high are the only controls). Needless to say when 42.2 degrees struck on the third day, the hotel room was not cool enough, it felt like half air conditioning at best.
reviews.title: Good hotel but let itself down with poor airconditioning and bad breakfasts

reviews.text: This meant less than satisfactory sleep, and discomfort in the room.
reviews.title: Best trip ever. Great Hotel!

reviews.text: I enjoy free breakfast as a Jade member of the Shangri La hotels loyalty program, though we didn't eat breakfast on the first or second morning. On the last day we did venture down, and as I have been disapppointed before was not expecting much. I was not disappointed. It is chaos in the breakfast room, and food is boring, stale looking and the fruit is all cheap quality and tastless. The juices are all cheap and sugary, nothing fresh. The price, about 35 AUD ++ is high. It really is a waste of time to eat breakfast in the hotel, you better wander down to a cafe in town or even to McDonalds, as it will surely be tastier and fresher.

reviews.text: The hotel rooms are tired and dated, but comfy. The view was nice (opera house, upgraded due to card).. This hotel could use a renovation job - would recommend they close it for thelve months and turn it really upmarket, to true Shangri La standards, and then they could charge a premium as the location is quite favoured by both business people and tourists.

reviews.text: One of the best experiences I have ever had, pulling back the curtain in the bedroom and seeing the Opera house. Well worth paying the extra for a room with a view. The standards and quality of the rooms and reception staff were exactly what you would expect from a hotel of this standard. However the necessity to charge for everything, including $30 to have a minibar emptied, does let the hotel down a little, particulary given the rates they are charging.

reviews.text: The only downside from the hotel's point of view was the attitude of the staff in the Horizon bar, as if they were doing us a favour for letting us have cocktail, but the view was spectacular and this made up for the staff. When I go back to sydney I will be staying there again, without a doubt.

reviews.title: Perfect Five-Star View
reviews.text: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel in a Opera House view room on the 29th floor during April 2006. The hotel is really well presented from reception through to the individual rooms. If you stay here a must do is dine in the Altitude restaurant but book in advance if you wish to have a window table. The views are the only thing better than the food. The rooms are spacious and well furnished and well maintained by housekeeping. If in Sydney again there will be no where else to consider.

The Shangri-La's Premier Grand Harbor King room had the most breathtaking and magnificent view of the Sydney Opera House and the Bridge. The bed was incredibly comfortable and sumptuous, the decor sophisticated and subtle, and the bathroom was spacious and luxurious. The staff at the hotel is excellent, I enjoyed the nightly turndown service. Centrally located and within walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, George Street, and the downtown area. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: What a View!

reviews.text: We have just returned from a visit to Sidney. Our initial stay was in Sidney and the Shangri La Hotel our first three nights. We were on the 21st floor and we arrived late in the evening. The bed was already turned down and the drapes were closed. The next morning, I opened the drapes and to my astonishment, we had a tremendous view of the harbor with both the bridge and opera house. In fact, I took pictures out of our window since it was perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Shangri La – the Horizon package at extra cost for the additional benefits it offers - as a special surprise for my new wife – this trip is our Honeymoon – and we were both really looking forward to staying at the hotel. However the experience thus far has been a complete disappointment.
reviews.title: No major complaints

reviews.text: Firstly, we spent 40 minutes in the reception whilst the receptionist muddled around with the computer. After asking us if it was our Honeymoon she said that she would check us in as we’d “only have to wait in a line at the Horizon reception”. We finally received our room keys and were told to go to the 31st floor where unfortunately the coffee service had finished but we could wait there whilst they prepared our room. We had just had a 7 hour trip and really just wanted to relax in our room but agreed to wait. After discovering our key cards didn’t allow us access to the lift we eventually made it to the Horizon club lounge on the 35th floor. We waited for 10 more minutes then tried to access our room, again couldn’t get the lift to work so asked the receptionist at the bar (who was very helpful) and she showed us to the 30th floor (where we should have been directed in the first place). Finally got our correct keys and got to our room where we discovered two single beds. IT’S OUR HONEYMOON! So, it was back to the club lounge to complain. One of the staff pointed at her colleague who explained that all king rooms were taken and that there wasn’t much she could do. After some complaining by my wife she agreed to upgrade us after one night to a king room with harbour view which we were really pleased about. At this point we also had to ask about how the Horizon package works – which we’d paid extra for remember- as no one had bothered to advise us about the Horizon lounge on the 30th floor where complimentary drinks are provided or any of the other hotel facilities included in the Horizon package. So, after that it was back to lift where key card wouldn’t work again. After spending 5 minutes going up and down in the lift we finally got back to main reception to get keys coded again. We finally got into our room one hour after arriving at reception and I’m not really looking forward to a night spent in single beds!
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel looks fantastic and the views are something really special but when you are spending almost £800 on a hotel for three nights you expect some level of good service. It has been one disaster after another and I would urge anyone thinking of staying here to think again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights in early January in a harbour room view - good spacious room with great view of the the harbour , bridge and opera house . We couldn't see the harbour from the bed so might be worth checking if your room bed would . Nice gym, pool and sauna to chill at the end of a day sightseeing , rooftop bar worth a visit , breakfast included in deal which was a pleasure in itself . Staff were very helpful and attentive . Easy access to reataurants and bars in the Rocks, short walk to Circular Quay for ferries , buses and George Streeet which is one of city's shopping arteries. Recommend Pony and Fish on the rocks restaurants nearby for nice food and athmosphere . 5 min walk to the bridge. Hotel is on a hill so a climb via steps but very manageable , unless you are very out of shape. Hotel is pricey but so are most things in Sydney - we felt it was worth it - and it was a great way to wind up a 3 week stay in Australia.
reviews.title: Treat yourself and your partner

reviews.text: We stayed at the Shangri-La for 3 nights with our 9 and 12 years old children during Christmas. When we had waited about an hour after the regular check-in time, we made a small complaint to the reception staff. Shangri-la immediately showed their true service level by providing free drinks to the whole family in the lobby café. After more waiting and yet another complaint to the reception, the front desk manager took action and told our kids that “she would show them something they would probably like”. Then, we were upgraded to a corner suite on the 33rd floor with access to the Horizon Club (lounge). Wow! It was definitely worth the long waiting time.
reviews.title: Centrally located hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located and it is just 5 minutes walking distance to Circular Quay, 15 minutes to Darling Harbour and 10 minutes to The Rocks. You can reach everything by feet! There are some other reviews complaining about the steep hill up to the hotel, but we did not consider this as an issue at all. Everybody need some exercise after all the good food! If you do not want to go all the way, you can always use the basement entrance.
reviews.title: Huge Rooms, Amazing Location and Staff

reviews.text: My wife tried the spa and kids and I tried the indoor swimming pool and sauna. We also spent some quality time in the Horizon Club enjoying the drinks, delicious “tapas” food, top service and magnificent views towards the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Make sure you are there around 6PM each evening.
reviews.title: Wedding Anniversary ... with the Kids!
Dropped standard
reviews.text: The only negative thing I can say about Shangri-La is that their booking process is a bit complicated when you have more than one child and you want to stay in the same room. The web site allows only two adults OR two children. When you contact them by email or through their chat service, you get different answers and room recommendations depending on which person you talk to. Some Shangri-la hotels allow it and some say you can only have one child in the room. Some are strict on the age limit of 12 years and some are not. We have experience with several Shangri-Las in China, Philippines, Singapore and Australia. This is much easier and straight forward at other hotels.
Liked: All staff encountered were very pleasant; a good size gym with relatively new equipments (touch screen control panels for treadmills etc); free in-room broadband; quiet room; comfortable bed.

reviews.text: We just enjoyed a fantastic 5 night stay at Shangri-La, Sydney. We booked (through Expedia) a Premier Harbour View Room ie is one of the corner suites (rooms ending in 13). We had the most amazing view over Sydney Harbour including the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. The room was huge and the service second to none. The staff are all extremely customer friendly and professional. All our room service orders, whether it be breakfast or dinner, were set up on a table next to the window (or wherever we chose) so we could eat while taking in the view. We didn't have the best weather in Sydney but the room more than made up for it, it was great. We also found the location great. It is in the Rocks area, handy to Circular Quay and not too far a walk into the CBD for shopping. We stayed in 1513 and noted down the number as we know we will want to go back for a weekend sometime. An awesome experience.

We stayed there for 5 nights for our honey moon. We had a grand harbour view room which gives you a wonderfull view on the opera and the bridge. We were lucky to have a fireworks right on the opera one night.

reviews.text: The location of this hotel in The Rocks area of Sydney provides a perfect setting to explore the area around the Circular Quay and the Opera. The view from our room and from the restaurant/bar at the top was simply magical. We could see the Sydney Harbor Bridge and the Sydney Opera House from our window and watch the ferries as they skittered about the harbor. Though the weather was wet while we were there, the setting and proximity to excellent restaurants, museums, and the harbor itself more than compensated. The room itself was comfortably furnished and obviously had been recently updated. Combining the view and the room itself, staying any where else if I returned to Sydney would be a disappointment.
reviews.title: Wow, what a view
My favoriate Hotel in Sydney - Shangri-La Hotel Sydney
reviews.text: My family and I had a wonderful 3 days there, the rooms are large and have great veiws, the team are professional and friendly, the new restaurant on the top floor Altitute was amazing, the new chef there has done a wonderful job on the menu and everything we ate was mouth watering and the staff there gave us great recommendations on food and wine.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in July for our first trip to Australia. We arrived at night so did not really have any idea where to wander at night! Very foolish since in the morning when we went for a walk we discovered we were right in the heart of the Rocks. The hotel is in a great location for walking to Circular Quay, Harbour Bridge, Opera House, Botanic Gardens and the main shopping area as well as the Rocks itself which has some nice shops and cafes. Hotel itself was really nice and the bar on the top floor was really good (although service was slow). Would definitley stay there again.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.text: Stayed at Shangri La for 5 nights and had booked a Deluxe Grand Harbour View Room. On arrival met by very friendly porters. Reception staff and check-in process were refreshingly quick. We arrived at approx 9am and were delighted that we were able to gain immediate access to our room. At check in we were initially offered a room on the 7th floor, however having read previous reviews we requested a room on a higher floor - got floor 28. Beware of lower floor rooms - there is a highway that runs past the hotel, so possibility of noise and certainly a spoilt view!!
reviews.title: Great View, Great Hotel, Great City !

likes.disliked: — The uphill walk to the hotel

reviews.text: The room was spacious and the view awesome - to our left the Harbour Bridge and to our right the Opera House. Two large twin beds, tv, Tea/Coffee facilities, large bathroom with bath & separate shower. The room had a safe and if you wish Safety Deposit Boxes are available through reception (free - but don't lose the key it will cost you $AU300). A newspaper is delivered to your room each morning, and the beds turned back in the evening. Bathrobes & slippers provided in the room - very handy if you go down to the pool! The pool and Gym are on the 4th floor. The pool was a bit murky but of a reasonable 15m size (and very quiet). Water was a bit chilly but the spa pool made up for that. Didn't use the gym but it appeared well equipped and quity busy. You can book treatments in the spa or visit the hairdresser. There is a gift shop in the basement - we thought it may prove expensive, but was certainly on a par with, and sometimes cheaper than, other shops in the area. Breakfast in the hotel is quite expensive, however if you go out of the hotel's rear door there is a little coffee shop (Gloucester Street Pantry) which offers a selection of pastries, sandwiches, cakes, fruit cups etc. There is a pub (Harts) next door to the hotel - a bit like stepping back to the 70s. If you just want a quick, basic bite to eat then its handy, but certainly dated compared to the many restaurants you wll find around Circular Quay. The hotels own Altitude Restaurant on the 36th Floor offers fantastic food with views to match (smart dress).
reviews.title: from someone who knows the place

reviews.text: We stayed at the Shangri La twice as part of our honeymoon. On our first visit, I had booked a Premier Grand Harbour View King this was fabulous corner room which had views of both the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. We arrived on a very early fight from Singapore and were at the hotel by approx 7am, we were very pleased to discover that our room was ready and we were able to check in and more importantly get a couple of hours sleep before heading out to see the sights.

reviews.title: Fantastic Views
reviews.text: On our second visit, I had booked the cheaper Deluxe Opera House View King, however, on arrival we were upgraded to Grand Harbour view room again. This room was not on the corner but the view was almost as good and in some ways the layout of the room was better.

reviews.title: So-so about the Shangri La
reviews.text: In general, the rooms were very good and the bathrooms excellent. The service was also very good and we found the concierge particularly helpful in sorting out restaurant bookings, they even managed to get us a table at Tetsuya's at short notice.

We paid a couple of visits to the Blu Horizon bar although the view is excellent and the staff try to move you to a table close to the window as soon as they come available, we found the drinks service to be very slow. On one occasion we had to gulp down cocktails because we had waited so long and we had to leave for our restaurant reservation plus don't expect any preferential treatment because you are a hotel guest.

reviews.text: Our stay June 10-15 at the Shangri-la was a real pleasure. On arriving early Sunday morning before check-in time, we were offered the opportunity to freshen up at the health club which was a real convenience. We asked for an received a room on a high floor with an Opera House view which was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff was courteous and efficient throughout our stay.

description: The Shangri-La Hotel, Sydney is perfectly positioned between the iconic Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the historic Rocks district. Within walking distance of the city's major shopping venues and tourist attractions, the hotel offers panoramic views of Sydney Harbour. A wide selection of dining options including Australian cuisine at award winning Altitude Restaurant, Mix and Grill in the all day dining restaurant Café Mix and fabulous cocktails at the glamorous Blu Bar on 36.
